name: cy.data
descr: Read and write developer-defined data associated with the graph.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the field to get.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the field to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set for the field.

formats.name: cy.data
formats.descr: Update multiple data fields at once via an object.

args.name: obj
args.descr: The object containing name-value pairs to update data fields.

name: cy.removeData
descr: Remove developer-defined data associated with the elements.

formats.name: cy.removeData
formats.descr: Removes all mutable data fields for the elements.

formats.name: cy.removeData
formats.descr: Removes the specified mutable data fields for the elements.

args.name: names
args.descr: A space-separated list of fields to delete.

name: cy.scratch
descr: Set or get scratchpad data, where temporary or non-JSON data can be stored.  App-level scratchpad data should use namespaces prefixed with underscore, like `'_foo'`.  This is analogous to the more common [`ele.scratch()`](#ele.scratch) but for graph global data.

formats.name: cy.scratch
formats.descr: Get the entire scratchpad object for the core.

formats.name: cy.scratch
formats.descr: Get the scratchpad at a particular namespace.

formats.name: cy.scratch
formats.descr: Set the scratchpad at a particular namespace.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value to set at the specified namespace.

name: cy.removeScratch
descr: Remove scratchpad data.  You should remove scratchpad data only at your own namespaces.  This is analogous to the more common [`ele.removeScratch()`](#ele.removeScratch) but for graph global data.

formats.name: cy.removeScratch
formats.descr: Remove the scratchpad data at a particular namespace.
